meanings.definition: To make or become stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: After the cold wind blew, the leaves would stiffen.
meanings.sent2: The old book's pages would stiffen over time.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bend the frozen stick only made it stiffen more.
meanings.sent4: His face stiffened with fear as he heard the loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The dough began to stiffen as she added more flour.

meanings.sent1: She would stiffen at the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent2: His body would stiffen in anticipation of the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat would stiffen its body before pouncing on the toy.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room made the air stiffen.
meanings.sent5: His jaw would stiffen whenever he was angry.

meanings.definition: To make more severe or strict.
meanings.sent1: The new rules would stiffen the penalties for late submissions.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's tone would stiffen when students misbehaved.
meanings.sent3: The principal's announcement would stiffen the school's dress code.
meanings.sent4: The law would stiffen the consequences for speeding.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to stiffen its policies on data security.
